name: Video Broadcast
description: Sector template for broadcast video patents including DVB, ATSC, cable TV, satellite, and hybrid broadcast-broadband technologies.
contextDescription: Video broadcast patents cover traditional and next-generation broadcast technologies. Key areas include DVB (DVB-T/T2, DVB-S/S2, DVB-C), ATSC (ATSC 1.0, ATSC 3.0), cable systems, satellite distribution, and hybrid broadcast-broadband (HbbTV). Targets include broadcast equipment manufacturers, pay-TV operators, and TV receiver manufacturers.
scoringGuidance: ATSC 3.0 patents are high value as US broadcasters transition to next-gen broadcast.
Hybrid broadcast-broadband (HbbTV) patents bridge traditional and streaming - strategic value.
DVB-T2/S2 patents remain valuable in European and international markets.
Live broadcast latency reduction patents are increasingly important for sports/events.
Patents covering broadcast-to-IP conversion enable cord-cutting infrastructure.

questions.question: Which broadcast standard(s) does this patent apply to? Score 1-3 for legacy (analog, ATSC 1.0), 4-6 for current (DVB-T2, DVB-S2), 7-10 for next-gen (ATSC 3.0) or multi-standard.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify broadcast standards: DVB-T/T2, DVB-S/S2, DVB-C, ATSC 1.0/3.0, ISDB, cable.

questions.question: Does this patent cover transmission (broadcast equipment), reception (receivers/TVs), or both? Score 1-4 for transmission-only, 5-7 for reception-only, 8-10 for both.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Receiver patents have broader target base (all TVs). Transmission targets broadcast infrastructure.

questions.question: Does this patent address hybrid broadcast-broadband scenarios? Score 1-3 if broadcast-only, 4-6 for basic hybrid, 7-10 for advanced HbbTV, ATSC 3.0 interactive, or seamless broadcast-OTT.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Hybrid technologies bridge broadcast and streaming. Assess integration sophistication.

questions.question: Is this patent specific to live or linear broadcast? Score 1-3 for VOD/non-live, 4-6 for linear programming, 7-10 for live events with low-latency requirements.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Live broadcast patents are strategic for sports/news. Assess live-specific optimizations.

questions.question: Does this patent address broadcast-specific signal processing? Consider: channel coding, modulation, multiplexing, error correction for broadcast channels.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify broadcast PHY/MAC innovations: OFDM, LDPC, interleaving, SFN.
